title: System can be shut down without save file warnings
OB: When I attempt to shut down the system without saving my file, there is no warning or dialog box displayed.
EB: The system should provide a dialog box with the message 'Do you want to save your file?' along with options to select 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel'. If 'Cancel' is selected, the shutdown process should be halted.
SR:
1. Open any application and make changes to a file.
2. Close the application without saving the file.
3. Observe if a warning dialog box with the given message and options is displayed.
